intro: Spermacoce mitreoloides, commonly known as the Brazilian morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and opposite leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
